1493664151826321427.text: This hearing will examine what changes need to be made to keep international orgs relevant & effective. I congratulate our witness, @State_IO on her confirmation and look forward to our continued work with her bureau to address policy and management challenges. (6/6)

1493664150907723781.text: Recently, Congress has made significant progress to strengthen our global leadership – and I am grateful to the State Department Bureau of International Organization Affairs for the assistance they provided with the COMPETES Act to support US participation w/the @UN. (5/6)

1493664150094024711.text:
Whether it’s a worldwide pandemic, or armies massing on international borders with threats of invasion, we are facing old challenges in a new guise. 
 
Right now, Russia’s military buildup and potential invasion of Ukraine is a pressing challenge to our postwar order. (4/6)

1493664149171232777.text:
More than 75 years after the signing of the @UN Charter, we see signs of a need to strengthen international organizations to respond to new threats. 

Challenges like climate change & climate-driven migration have major impacts on geopolitics & how we live our lives. (3/6)

1493664148345044999.text: The United Nations has kept the peace between major powers for decades and plays a critical role in peacekeeping around the world. The established system of international organizations, including the @UN, has advanced our technical & humanitarian cooperation in many areas. (2/6)
